Package org.graphstream.ui.graphicGraph.stylesheet

Definition of style sheets and styles.

Interface Summary
StyleSheetListener Listener for style events.
 

Class Summary
Colors Ordered set of colours.
Rule Style application rule.
Selector A selector is the part of a CSS rule that defines to which element a style applies in the graph.
Style A style is a whole set of settings for a graphic element.
StyleConstants The various constants and static constant conversion methods used for styling.
StyleSheet Implementation of the style sheets that can be stored in the graphic graph.
Value A value and the units of the value.
Values Several values and the units of these values.

Selector.Type Types of elements.

StyleConstants.StrokeMode How to draw the contour of the element.

StyleConstants.TextBackgroundMode  
StyleConstants.TextMode How to draw the text of an element.
StyleConstants.TextStyle Variant of the font.
StyleConstants.TextVisibilityMode How to show the text of an element.
StyleConstants.Units The available units for numerical values.
StyleConstants.VisibilityMode How to show an element.
 

Package org.graphstream.ui.graphicGraph.stylesheet Description

Definition of style sheets and styles.

The org.graphstream.ui.graphicGraph.stylesheet.parser sub-package provide a JavaCC parser for the style sheets defined in this package.

This package contains several classes that concentrate on the definition of a style sheet, its contents, and the way they allow fast drawing of a very large number of graph elements.

The Style class contains the definition of a single style. A style is a set of pairs (property,value) that can inherit another style or link to a set of alternative styles (also known as meta-classes, or events).

Inside the style the values can be colours, strings and numeric values. Numeric values can use units of measure. This is why most numeric values in the style sheet are stored as instances of Value. This class stores a value an the units of measure it is expressed in.

In the style sheet, the styles are not referred directly, they are contained in Rules. A rule is a pair (selector,style). The Selector class defines the set of elements the style applies to, it can be loosely compared to a regular expression.

The StyleSheetListener allows to listen at events occurring in the style sheet.
